reviews.title: So cool
text: Graffiti Alley in Queen West is truly a hidden treasure in Toronto. This street is covered in incredible graffiti art & well worth a visit! Graffiti Alley is the type of spot that gives a city their charm & uniqueness! Super unique & talented works of art to check out! Take your time & explore around- every nook & turn awaits with more art to see. We spent over a hour checking it all out, taking photos & soaking the local talent in!

reviews.title: Great
text: Worth a detour
Some really great art scattered amongst the less good
Not the easiest place to find as there is lots of construction blocking off roads so persevere

reviews.title: Colorful
text: We enjoyed coming through here and took lots of pics but were kind of surprised at how small it was. It's really just a few blocks. If you're into graffiti art at all, it is a must-see. There's great street art all over Toronto though, so don't worry if you miss this one area.

reviews.title: Worth a walk through if you are going to be in the area
text: This is a big outdoor art space a couple of blocks long between Queen and Richmond. The graffiti itself is a pretty mixed bag. Some of it is very good and other stuff is not so good or just tagging material. However, I enjoyed it a lot and the good works are very good. I think it is also a popular filming area since a bunch of young men were shooting a video when I was there. I think it is a good place to go if you are generally in the area and are looking for something to do after other attractions are closed, such as the museums. I think I was there for about 45 mins and that was more than enough (partly because the guys filming slowed everyone down). A lot of people were also taking photos there.

reviews.title: A fun walk near Chinatown
text: We walked through briefly before our visit to Chinatown. It was a fun, off the beaten path activity to do with our two 7 year olds. There are a number of parks nearby with playgrounds as well as many cafes if you want to make a full morning hike r afternoon out of it.

reviews.title: Crazy and fun
text: This back alley open air art exhibit is vibrant and imaginative. It is worth checking out when in the area. Take a stroll, immerse yourself in colors and have fun.

reviews.title: Clever artists
text: I visited after walking from Chinatown, I have to say there aresome really good artworks and the passage is full of colour . Glad i visited but a little out of the way unless in the area

reviews.title: Worth a trip!
text: If youâ€™re around Queen st w, Chinatown in Toronto, Graffiti Alley is worth a half hour of your time, especially if you are artistic or have artists in the making.  So much great art to see and absorb, itâ€™s an experience just to try and figure out meanings and grasp more recent pop culture references.  My teenage daughter loved it, see was engaged and impressed.  Take some time and enjoy Graffiti Alley!

reviews.title: Outstanding Art
text: I love street art and so it is something I try and hunt down when I visit anywhere. Whilst visiting my family one of them suggested visiting Graffiti Alley in Downtown Toronto and I was really glad I did. There is some amazing artwork there. It is not just people tagging buildings.
If you like unusual art I definitely recommend visiting this area. It's AMAZING!

reviews.title: Lost & but finally found the colorful ARTS ðŸŽ¨
text: We tried using Google Map to walk from Union Station to Graffiti Alley. Got lost and finally found the Graffiti Alley after more than 30 minutes.  Too hungry so just ate a pad thai at a corner small  restaurant.  At first, felt a  bit unsafe as some guys in the restaurant were gawking at us.
I liked the Graffiti Alley for the colorful arts and definitely it is a place for good pictures. There were some tourists there so I would say it's pretty safe in daylight.
After visiting for 20 minutes, we headed out to Queen Street, the main shopping belt in Toronto.  It is easier walking to Graffiti Alley via the main road of Queen Street.

reviews.title: Colourful stroll
text: Colourful stroll down an alley / back lane with a good variety of different large graffiti murals. The artists are very talented and it was fun to see while walking around Toronto. The neighbourhood is hip . We went during the day after heavy rain (the sun was out again), but there were plenty of deep puddles to avoid. Perhaps not as cool as  Seattleâ€™s gum wall alley,  it is definitely worth checking out if you are in that part of town.

reviews.title: Surprisingly worth the visit
text: This attraction on our list was something to kill the time for an hour or so. We didn't expect much but it was a pleasantly surprising attraction.
A lot of the art work is visually stunning. There are plenty of alleys to look at and we felt very safe doing so.
We couldn't stop taking pictures there and would highly recommend it to anyone.

reviews.title: Beautiful street art
text: Spanning several blocks, graffiti alley has many beautiful murals and smaller, whimsical creations.   The colors are vibrant and the works vary in content.    Location is adjacent to some fun shops and casual restaurants.    We enjoyed it greatly.

reviews.title: Fun tourist area
text: Graffiti Alley is good for a walk as it takes you down several streets/into more than one neighbourhood (it stradles the Fashion District and Alexandria Park). Definitely a cool spot for photos, but can get busy with tourists on warm days.

reviews.title: Worth a visit if in the area
text: This is an interesting sight; plenty of urban art along a stretch of back alley. Worth a walk down while in the area. I felt safe while there during an afternoon

reviews.title: A bit smaller than expected, but nice.
text: I was worried our Uber wouldn't find.  In the end, its a small block of graffiti.  It was nice to walk the street and admire the street art.  To do if in the neighborhood.

reviews.title: Neat urban art
text: Neat to check out. Cool to see the work of talented graffiti artists. Unique part of downtown Toronto.  Even has its own street sign.  Thereâ€™s also a nice memorial garden in the middle of the alley.
The alley smells and you have to watch out for pot holes while you walk but worth it if you enjoy graffiti.  Street parking in the area.

reviews.title: Art.Anyone?
text: Unusual to see so much graffiti in two to three blocks or more of alleyways.Happy to see a designated area to showcase graffiti art.Under equipped to understand graffiti but can still attempt to appreciate it.

reviews.title: Beautiful work!
text: We enjoyed our coffees while walking down graffiti alley! Beautiful work! Very interesting and fun spot to take pictures!

reviews.title: What a photo opportunity
text: We traveled down here to see Graffiti Alley and were not disappointed. So many colors and such talent.

reviews.title: Not worth it
text: Dodgy alley, mediocre art. Plenty other opportunities to see lovely graffiti around the streets of Toronto. I wouldnâ€™t waste my time

reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin. A mix of graffiti and street art.
text: Probably was expecting too much but ultimately it was fine. One end has a lot of pretty great street art whilst the other does tend towards justâ€¦ graffiti??!!
That said, worth popping through if you are in the vicinity but I wouldnâ€™t go out of your way.

reviews.title: Wouldnâ€™t travel to see it.
text: It takes about 10 or less minutes to walk through  , itâ€™s nice to see but I wouldnâ€™t travel far to see it. There is plenty of nice street art throughout the city. I wouldnâ€™t go out of my way to visit it but if you are nearby then worth a visit.

reviews.title: Worth a quick visit - lovely vibrant street art
text: Worth a quick 10 minutes or so visit.
Lots of really interesting and detailed street art.
Only a short alley so doesnâ€™t take long to check out.
Very vibrant colours really make the alley stand out.

reviews.title: Graffiti Alley
text: Walked through Graffiti Alley for the first time Aug 20th, 2022.  It was so much better than I thought it would be!  Whimsical, funny, strange, animals, portraits - itâ€™s all there.  Loved it!,  Also checked out a few of the Banksy art in a different part of the city, which was interesting, but enjoyed Graffiti Alley more.

reviews.title: Walked down at dusk to see graffiti art~
text: Fun street to walk down after dinner. The family enjoy seeing the Graffiti art. We walked down the street at dusk. We were pretty much the only ones there.

reviews.title: Amazing art display
text: Looking and taking pictures while I was there, it's a hidden jem if you do visit Tronto down town you have to go here.

reviews.title: Cool place for some art
text: Walked down the couple blocks of this alley and really enjoyed it.  Had some really cool pieces and some great photo ops.

reviews.title: Beautiful street art in a stinky alley
text: Beautiful street art in a stinky alleyway littered with empty bottles. Interesting to see the murals painted over the old ones. Great photo ops. My kids 6 and 8 years old loved the cute characters painted on the backs of buildings. We went at 9am on a Sunday and it was deserted.

reviews.title: Colorful and original.
text: Colorful and original.  A great free activity.  A few blocks worth of walking.  Wide variety of subject matter.

reviews.title: Bring a camera and go nuts!
text: Wow! This is about four blocks of amazing artwork and graffiti. Some of the pieces are mind blowing, and the best part, is that it is constantly changing and new pieces were being spray painted whilst were walked down it.
Highly recommend this, but bring a camera as you will be snapping away all day!

reviews.title: Very colorful, but street needs some clean-up
text: Located near Toronto's Chinatown, this alley, which runs across three blocks, is full of graffiti, some of which are really beautiful and artistic. I just hope that they would clean the street to make it look wholesome and more attractive to tourists. With all its wall paintings, this alley really looks like an open-air museum for free! ðŸ˜€

reviews.title: Street art FREE to see in Toronto
text: Free to visit. The alley is fully covered in street art - graffiti. It became famous after the famous Ricky Mercer rants in the alley. Ricky is a famous Canadian journalist. Very respected  all around. It is a great place e to visit.

reviews.title: Went there. Felt dangerous. Then left.
text: Went there. Felt dangerous. Then left.
Just kiddingâ€¦ The place must be cool for street art lovers and perfect for Instagram photos! I on the contrary only took 1 photo.

reviews.title: Graffiti not murals
text: It is exactly what it says on the tin.  A wide alley running for about 200 yards with the walls, water bins etc covered with graffiti. Worth a look if you are in the area.  I was a little disappointed it wasnâ€™t more mural based, but then again it wouldnâ€™t be a graffiti alley then

reviews.title: Great for Instagram
text: Loved this place great for Instagram photos.
A must visit when in Toronto.
Spent a good hour or so here.

reviews.title: Nice art
text: I love art so I truly enjoyed graffiti alley. However I stopped to take a picture and all I could smell was urine. It seemed to be a popular tourist destination spot and the murals were nice.

reviews.title: Worth a stroll, glad we saw it.
text: quick walk thru - but take time to look at art, and make sure you see side streets and alley, not to be misled that it is only one little side street or two. Doesn't take long to see it - a handful of blocks.    If nearby worthwhile going to see.

reviews.title: Nice murals but...
text: This was our last stop before leaving Toronto. It was nice to wander around and see most of the alley. There are many interesting murals there. That being said I have to say that this is not a place or an attraction I will send a friend to. Most of the alley smells like pee and poop, and it doesn't look like the city cares much about it because it felt like people go there to dump stuff.

reviews.title: Graffiti thatâ€™s actual art! Can you do that?
text: So, I can see why this place is overly underestimated. After all? Itâ€™s legit called, â€˜Graffiti Alleyâ€™ and itâ€™s off the beaten path and takes a little work to find.
Guys! Itâ€™s worth it. Have some grace, K? Covid happened and the dreamers who aspired to be artists and movie stars spent their days indoors. Didnâ€™t we all? ISH?
Depending on the day, you may experience overflowing cans and litter, but hey! Toronto is a metropolis. You have trash pickup on your own street, right?
Itâ€™s absolutely charming and you wonâ€™t regret it!
